This will be the second time she's run for office. She ran against Barbara
Boxer for a California senate seat in 2010, sinking millions of her own
money into the campaign, and losing. During that race, the Boxer camp
published an ad that blasted Fiorina's time at HP.

But her reign at HP ended in her ouster — as she described it in a 60
Minutes interview in 2006, she was suddenly, and without warning, fired.
That was the first time HP ever fired a CEO. It wouldn't be the last.
Here's what she's known for at HP:
Buying Compaq over the strong objections of some board members. Fiorina is
probably best known for leading HP into a very bitter and public
board-level fight over the acquisition of Compaq. She wanted to buy the
big PC rival and turn HP into the biggest PC maker. A faction of the
board, led by Walter Hewlett (son of internally revered company
co-founder William Hewlett), opposed the buy and launched a proxy fight.
